abstract: Judge Steven T O’Neill rules deposition testimony from civil lawsuit against Bill Cosby, in which comedian said he obtained quaaludes in order to help him have sex with women, can be admitted as evidence in upcoming criminal trial for sexual assault against former Temple University staff member Andrea Constand.
lead_paragraph: In deposition testimony from a 2005 civil lawsuit, the star acknowledged obtaining quaaludes as part of his efforts to have sex with women.
snippet: In deposition testimony from a 2005 civil lawsuit, the star acknowledged obtaining quaaludes as part of his efforts to have sex with women....

headline.main: Bill Cosby’s Testimony on Drugs Can Be Evidence in Sexual Assault Trial, Judge Rules
headline.print_headline: Cosby’s Drug Testimony Can Be Used in Assault Trial
